summary: An email from attorney Sigrid McCawley to an unnamed recipient, providing information about email accounts and computer systems used by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, referencing testimony about the MindSpring/Citrix email server and identifying individuals within Epstein's organization.

connections.description: Both used the MindSpring network to communicate with employees; Maxwell is identified as part of Epstein's organization.
Mark Lumber worked only for Jeffrey Epstein, setting up his computer systems.
McCawley, as an attorney, is providing information about Epstein's case, specifically his email systems.

events.title: Testimony on MindSpring/Citrix System
events.description: A witness provides testimony about the MindSpring server and Citrix program used by Epstein's organization for internal communication and email.

keyFacts: Epstein and Maxwell used a MindSpring network and Earthlink email accounts to communicate with employees.
The MindSpring system was a pre-email message system connecting Epstein's offices, houses, employees, and friends.
Mark Lumber, a computer technician who worked exclusively for Epstein, set up the MindSpring system from New York and installed it in Palm Beach.
Epstein's organization used Citrix software to link computers for email and internet access within the organization.
The email identifies Ghislaine Maxwell and other unnamed co-conspirators as part of Epstein's organization.
